website_summaries.verdict: Set of 14 pieces offered at a very low price point. Works with any common 1/4-inch shank.
pros: Consists of chrome vanadium steel that should perform better than other low-priced nut driver sets
7 traditional bits and 7 metric bits included
All bits fit into a compact clip that will attach to a work belt
Short shanks will help you when working in tight spaces
cons: Bits don't offer longevity in tough jobs
No hand driver included in the set

customer_reviews.title: Corrosion Prone
customer_reviews.text: I had been quite pleased with this little set. I hadn't used it much, but was happy knowing it was in what I called my "smalls" tool kit. Watches, computers, electronics...you know, small stuff. I recently opened the toolbox and saw these bits, right on top, all covered with a layer of surface rust. I was not at all happy. They are in a dry toolbox, inside an air-conditioned house, in the desert southwest. A drier environment you will not find. Can't imagine how quickly they would go south in any other situation. Keep that in mind.
customer_reviews.author: J. Yates

customer_reviews.title: Very useful.
customer_reviews.text: This nut driver bits for quick change systems is a bargain. It takes up little space in your tool box, works well and is well made for basic home use. The Tekton service is also great - they are quite responsive and helpful should you need their service. Excellent buy.
customer_reviews.author: Max™

customer_reviews.title: So-so Nut Driver Bits, by TEKTON
customer_reviews.text: TEKTON nut driver bits look nice and fit rather well, but not in the storage clip they are sold with (one of the smallest bits, on either side, SAE or metric, easily falls out). The bits snap right into the, but if I try to put any of them into Malco, orNut Driver Handle, their quick-change geometry seems to be mis-aligned with that of the the drivers, and thus bits won't hold. DeWalt nut driver bits fit well into the same handles though.
customer_reviews.author: Vards Uzvards

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for price
customer_reviews.text: As a woodworker I do not use nut drivers very often. That is why I bought a cheap set. The nut drivers themselves seem of fair quality , but two things that would frustrate me if I needed these on the job. The drivers easily fall out of the provided belt clip. When you attach the belt clip to a belt, you will need to have the drivers on the inside of the belt to see the sizes, a little thing , but not a pro tool.
customer_reviews.author: Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Have had them for a few years. I originally purchased them for my wife so she would stop taking them out of my larger sets and not putting them back. However after helping her with a few projects the product sits perfectly every time. I Purchased one for myself they are stored in a damp basement and there is zero corrosion on them.
customer_reviews.author: Flying Flynn

customer_reviews.title: Multiple sizes in a compact holder, at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I am really happy with this handy, compact addition to my toolkit. The bits are well-marked and in a good variety of sizes, and the red case is easy to spot in my bag. The case holds them securely, but if you lose one, the price makes it no big deal to buy it again! Packaging was good, Item arrived quickly, company follow-up by email was excellent, even before the product arrived the shipper emailed to ensure my satisfaction. The bits appear to be well made and sturdy. Overall, a nice set. I would not hesitate to buy from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Kerr

customer_reviews.title: Wear
customer_reviews.text: I have two sets of these drivers and use them on a regular basis. The 1/4" and the 5/16” get the most use and have unfortunately worn out. This I believe is due to the generous radius on the drivers which while making it easy to engage the head of a hex head screw it does not provide much purchase on the screw resulting in slippage and wear. The problem is compounded by the screws minimized head material and maximized shoulder angle. If you use these drivers on a regular basis you may experience this same problem, if however, the bits are used infrequently on home projects the bits should be adequate.
customer_reviews.author: AZUuser

customer_reviews.title: Saves space in a tool bag
customer_reviews.text: The set is great, don't have to carry a set of nut drivers anymore. I use a multi bit driver with a 1/4 inch drive anyways so these attach right in. Only problem is the little bearing which locks the bit place is missing so you can drop the bit from the driver very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Crites

customer_reviews.title: I was going nuts missing sizes!
customer_reviews.text: Good assortment of sizes with a belt clip built in (I haven't used that function) The Plastic feels of quality. The bits 'lock' into the plastic so they won't fall out, They come out a bit easier than the friction grip type holder. Only thing left is how long will the 'locking' part last till it wears out and the bits fall out? I doubt I will use it enough to find out in the next 20 years. Now I don't have to get my 101 bit kit out to remove a few nuts while on a job.
customer_reviews.author: Raw

customer_reviews.title: Cheap enough to throw in the tool bag.
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, you don't have a cordless drill nut driver bit set yet? Then add this to your cart and in 2 days you too can have this as part of your tool collection. Is this set the best set on the market? No, but it's the right price for you tinkering hobbiest who's looking to make your life a little easier. Keep in mind these are not magnetic or deep, but they'll work in 90% of your nut driving applications.
customer_reviews.author: Ninja Marinara

customer_reviews.title: Must Have Tool
customer_reviews.text: These are a must have. They are small and take very little space in your tool box. I use these with my Dewalt impact driver and they work great. Tekton makes some really nice tools for the DIYer. They also have great customer service if you ever have any issues. If this review helped please click yes below!
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Prone to rusting
customer_reviews.text: I've bought several of these over the years and they all develop rust very easily. Plastic holder is a nice idea but the drivers fall out at random. The price is affordable and the set covers most sizes. The handiness makes up for it's shortfalls. For the average DIY'er I'd recommend these but for continuous production work you might look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Diamond

customer_reviews.title: Super Compact & Portable
customer_reviews.text: These are extremely convenient as someone who works out of my truck. It's extremely compact and convenient to keep in the truck and grab on the go without taking up space. I haven't used these with any power tools so I can't comment on the durability, but they work well for the equipment I service. They are somewhat annoying to get out of the case, but I'd prefer that over falling out and getting lost certainly and the size makes that annoyance tolerable.
customer_reviews.author: Flashfire101

customer_reviews.title: A nice set of Nut Drivers for use with a power screw Driver.
customer_reviews.text: A nice neat package of nut drivers to work on my B&D power screwdriver in the house. Good sizes, all in a neat package easy to get at and easy to use. I have not had an occasion to use them yet, but they are well made, like the expensive nut drivers I use in my Shop. I am pleased with the purchase and the package.
customer_reviews.author: R. B. Sherman

customer_reviews.title: "0/2"  Beware, poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this set for a specific purpose so was anxious to receive it, but when I went to use it the 1/4 inch bit I wanted was missing. In its place was a duplicate 5/16 bit, very annoying. I requested a replacement and was informed I did not have to return the set. I received the second set and it was missing the 3/16 bit. At least now I have one complete set. So ,based on my experience, I would not recommend this product if you want a time sensitive delivery. However, if time is not a factor and you like "Russian Roulette", this is the set for you.
customer_reviews.author: MJT

customer_reviews.title: Useful and compact
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I work in the field. I don't run across nuts too often but I figured these would be a nice add instead of struggling with an adjustable wrench. Doesn't add much weight or take up much space. I have had no issues with them so far and has come in handy a couple times now.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up! Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Had the opportunity to use them this week with my impact driver. No issues using them and they got the job done. It's nice having both metric and standard size in your hand as well. Everything is leaning towards metric more and more. They stay in their holder with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price, working out very well
customer_reviews.text: This is my second set. We liked the first one so much that my son has it now. None of the drivers are a sloppy fit, so the nuts and bolts have never had a stripping issue. We were using the first set with a DeWalt impact driver, and they had held up very well for two years before they went to work with my son.
customer_reviews.author: T. Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit all quick-change chucks
customer_reviews.text: Great to find a set that includes metric nut drivers. Does not fit all quick-change chucks -- the hex shank isn't long enough to allow the bit to lock in. Bits will work fine in other normal 1/4in drivers, but not the Malco Connext2 stubby Quick Change driver/handle (ASIN: B00JJ6O75A). Another quick-change bit fit and locked into the Connext2 Stubby handle. Disappointed in the Tekton design.
customer_reviews.author: MBear

customer_reviews.title: Decent set and decent price.
customer_reviews.text: Got the set with the detents today. I am big on powering through the slack on screws and this helps make the fast. When these are in its holder it makes for a compact package. I separate my sockets SAE and Metri in different drawers so this doesn't follow that but I can live with it. I expect all this type of tools to last forever. I don't abuse them and i don't intend to use them on an impact driver so the usage is pretty mild/standard. Fit and finish are good, what do you expect of such a tool? Not shiny but I don't need it to be.
customer_reviews.author: JoninOC

customer_reviews.title: All of Tektons tools are pretty decent and their support is beyond fantastic
customer_reviews.text: All of Tektons tools are pretty decent and their support is beyond fantastic.It's a great operation for Regular Joe to tool up at the house. Better than Crapsman was/is whats left of the dummies, IMO.It's like KD was in the seventies but the ratchets are as good as ANY out there. Yeah. I said ANY and I have a couple
customer_reviews.author: Guanacaste Welding

customer_reviews.title: An Absolute Must For Every Toolbox
customer_reviews.text: If you have a power screwdriver, you absolutely need to buy this immediately. I can't believe I went years without having this honestly. When I went searching for this product online I couldn't believe the price listed for this, and had to triple-check the other reviews to make sure you were getting all of this for such a low price. When it arrived (and it arrived quickly!) I saw that it not only was everything I needed, but it also was constructed extremely well. These are not flimsy cheap pieces. They are extremely solid and look to me like they will last several lifetimes of use. I couldn't be more pleased with this purchase. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: J Walter Sprague

customer_reviews.title: Check before buying
customer_reviews.text: Bought item due to tekton name.. There are skipped sizes in metric set (i should have looked closed before buying), bits don't stay tight in holder and markings on holder have rubbed off after 2 weeks. Just disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: sthuw115

customer_reviews.title: Bargain for the price
customer_reviews.text: Solid and functional nut driver set. It was a bargain when I first bought it and price has dropped by 25% since then so I'm buying another set so that I can have one in each toolbox. They fit tightly into the holder so they won't fall out and they contain some of the most basic metric and imperial sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: Ok but not great
customer_reviews.text: Returned it as I they wouldnt fit and work to my drill. Suitable for occasional use.
customer_reviews.author: Rahul

customer_reviews.title: Bargain
customer_reviews.text: For a mere 5 bucks there are 14 different nut drivers in a convenient holder marked with the sizes. They make a handy addition to my tool collection. I have used them a number of times with my Dewalt impact driver and they suit my purposes far better than I had expected. As has been pointed out in numerous reviews, these nut drivers do not have indents or magnets. If you need either or both of those features then you don't want this set. I don't need either of those features and am satisfied with the performance of this set and the bargain price.
customer_reviews.author: Duffer.Top Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great bit set!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this along with the Maxcraft 60199 1/4-Inch Dual-Drive Mini Ratchet Driver in order to loosen up bolt heads that are difficult to access on my job. I have used these bits many times. In on instance, the ratchet was not large enough to fit into a tight space, but I was able to remove the 3/16" bit and use a 4" adjustable wrench to turn it from the stem, and it worked perfectly. without these bits, I would have been unable to loosen that bolt. Don't need it every day, but when you do, it's a life saver!
customer_reviews.author: FlashLightGuy

customer_reviews.title: Quick change is the best!
customer_reviews.text: I like the quick change feature the most and the holder is stiff but compact enough to stow the whole thing in my makita drill case very convenient. I don't know about their long term durability but seem like quality tekton's other tools seem to be doing alright so hopefully these will mirror the same quality.
customer_reviews.author: Hillbilly Mech

customer_reviews.title: Very nice nut driver bits
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an expert on power screwdrivers, but I do know that my DeWalt came with hex bits that have the recessed ring near the end. However, it came without any sort of nut drivers. All I wanted was a compatible set in a good range of English/Metric sizes. By now, you've probably figured out that I bought this Tekton set. And from the five stars, that I am pleased with the product. And you would be right, too. The little plastic holder is kind of clumsy; perhaps a small case would be a better storage medium. But that's not a real issue. I am now ready to tackle any normal hex nut situation, now and for decades to come.
customer_reviews.author: Teh Arbitrageur

customer_reviews.title: Price is right.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a Milwaukee 2462 impact driver. 3 of the bits will not lock into place. All the others lock just fine, but the 3/16, 5/16, and 7/16 wont. I cant see a difference that should cause this. I've been pretty happy with other Tekton tools before so I'll keep em.
customer_reviews.author: b.rad

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit all 1/4" impact drivers
customer_reviews.text: Some of the bits are not long enough to snap into my Ryobi P237 impact driver or my Milwaukee 48-03-4410 Shockwave 1/2-Inch Square by 1/4-Inch Hex Adapter. I can still use them, but they are not retained in the tool and can fall out of the collet. They seem alright enough for the price other than that, but I wouldn't recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Babb

customer_reviews.title: Can be Tough
customer_reviews.text: Removing the bits from the "holder" can be tough. The case doesn't want to let them go, which can be good to keep from losing bits, but also can make it a little tough to get them out. Once I was able to play with it a little, they eased up. Otherwise, work well, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Remotely Sad

customer_reviews.title: This Power Nut Driver set is the perfect addition to any individual's personal toolkit
customer_reviews.text: This Power Nut Driver set is the perfect addition to any individual's personal toolkit! Whether a professional contractor or an at-home handyman, the 14 differently sized nut drivers will help make any task much easier to accomplish. Each nut driver comes conveniently labeled with its size and the set as a whole can be clipped to any work-belt for easy and rapid access. You can't go wrong with this product!
customer_reviews.author: John V.

customer_reviews.title: They're good
customer_reviews.text: They don't stay in my driver, just slides out but fit well in my impact driver check, so maybe I need a new handheld driver with a locking spring inside. I would go for magnetic next time, but these get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: MScott

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: The fit, finish, and quality of these nut driver bits is very good and meets my expectations. I haven't had the chance to abuse these yet, but I would recommend these. Excellent value at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: D. Burns

customer_reviews.title: Good Set of Power Nut Drivers
customer_reviews.text: Received these bits today. They are still have no detents, but they work fine in a drill for driving prescribed nuts and bolt heads. Yes, if they had detents we could use them in a power screwdrivers and impact drivers (1/4" hex chucks), which would be a plus. Nonetheless, they get the job done in a drill chuck. When the company makes the same set in a detended shaft, I'll pick them up, too. Reasonable price and product in addition to my Dewalt nut-driver set (it has detents but not the spread of standard and metric sizes). Detents would have made Tekton's bit set a five-star item for their overall application in 1/4"-hex and standard-chuck power tools.
customer_reviews.author: Practical Desk

customer_reviews.title: just buy it
customer_reviews.text: These are not "impact" rated, however they are chrome vanadium, and if you have light work to do feel free to use your impact driver (with a drill there are no worries using these). I've owned these for a few years now, and use them regularly for light automotive work. The best selling point is all the sizes you might need in metric and SAE are there in a compact holder. A+ from me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must for electronics.
customer_reviews.text: Exact sizes that I needed for electronics. About the same metal as a Bostich set of phillips bit drivers that you would get from Walmart. The walls of the nut driver are slim and can fit into places that a normal socket would not fit. No problem with the 3/16 fitting over the stand off behind a computer where the vga port is.
customer_reviews.author: NoNo

customer_reviews.title: What a Bargain
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed at the high quality of these bits for the price I paid. The sockets are well constructed and are the tolerances for the various sizes are precise. The detents on the shafts help to lock them securely into my power drill. It would be nice if the sockets had magnetic inserts, even if it drove the cost a little bit, but again, for the money, I have no complaints. I strongly recommend this set of nut drivers. GJM
customer_reviews.author: Older than Old

customer_reviews.title: Better than a drive size AND socket adapter
customer_reviews.text: This set is SAE and metric both. Like a socket set but the basics for your 1/4" bit driver or power driver. Better than fishing out a separate socket set and matching the size to fit. This is a grab and go basic set.
customer_reviews.author: Buccaneer

customer_reviews.title: At least the sizes are right.
customer_reviews.text: I got the to use with my Milwaukee 12 volt and 18 bolt drivers. The reason I got the bits with the detents is so that they would lock in the driver's chuck. Evidently the bit sore too short as they will not lock into the chuck as the detent are intended to do. I might as well have spent a little less money and got the bits without the detent for all the good they're doing me now.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Montoya

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality nut drivers. Comes in a good amount of sizes for the bit. These will last you for someone who uses them on a daily for work.
customer_reviews.author: Bing

customer_reviews.title: They work great in my impact or drill
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered a couple sets of these. They work great in my impact or drill. I don't use them often, but I've never broke or stripped one. I just keep misplacing them. The red holder holds them very securely, almost too secure. They can be a chore to remove and replace. They still deserve the full 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: R. Veldman

customer_reviews.title: no magnet
customer_reviews.text: These nut driver's do not have magnets in them. Other then that they appear to be a quality produce. But have not used themyet.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Chapin

customer_reviews.title: Arts and Crafts Supplies
customer_reviews.text: These are used in my arts and crafts workshop. They work well and I'll be ordering more in the future!
customer_reviews.author: James Southard

customer_reviews.title: Life-savers
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, pocket-sized kit, ideal for anyone doing any HVAC, or rooftop work. Saves me tons of trips up and down ladders without carrying large toolkits.
customer_reviews.author: bigpapapurchase

customer_reviews.title: Like 'em
customer_reviews.text: Like these a lot better than my handled nut driver set. Compact, work great with impact driver. Bring the whole set instead of 12 different hand tool drivers. Will never use my regular nut drivers again.
customer_reviews.author: gsftest

customer_reviews.title: Tekton Driver Bit Set
customer_reviews.text: The great quality and assortment make these an excellent bargain. In the reviews some complained about no "detent" or "magnet" in them. Those features aren't really necessary anyway. I popped one into my Skil Mini Cordless Driver (which by the way holds the bits with it's own magnet) and it fits like a glove. Perfect set for precision work too! Only one trivial complaint...the holder has the size markings kind of off-set so the bits are not "over" the right size. Also, these bits are "really, really hard to remove" from the holder! It'll wreck your fingers so use pliers. But A+ overall!
customer_reviews.author: NYBob

customer_reviews.title: A nice handy set for around-the-house jobs
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use on a ratcheting screwdriver I have, for light around-the-house jobs, such as appliances, computers etc. I haven't tried it for anything requiring heavier duty and I doubt it would last long for such applications. For the price, quality seems more than decent. The plastic holder is a nice idea with a somewhat poor execution, as the holes are a bit too tight, making it hard to pull out the bits.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The packaging the product arrived in was a bubble packet that kept the product in good condition. Everything that came was described accurately. I really liked the nut driver bit attachments;They were sturdy and strong. Also, it was convenient that it came with a work belt storage clip that kept everything organized when I had to do a DIY project in my closet to replace a couple of shelves for more clothes storage.
customer_reviews.author: Aaliyah Smith-Israel

customer_reviews.title: Accurately sized, higher quality nut driver set.
customer_reviews.text: Accurately sized, higher quality nut driver set. Great value for the quality and the bit holder has a firm grasp on each bit so you're not likely to accidentally drop one. The belt loop is a nice feature if you are going to be on a ladder, or may need to use the different sizes of drivers. Having both metric and SAE is a great option too.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua J. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: handy set!
customer_reviews.text: good quality and very useful set, i use this set with my impact driver a lot, they fit very tight in the little case
customer_reviews.author: Cory Dillon Lett

customer_reviews.title: NOT magnetic
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice set in both S.A.E (American) and Metric sizes, well made and a great price, HOWEVER, Unless you are working at a tool bench, look for the magnetic type, which hold the screw or nut in the socket end. It was my mistake about ordering this set (non magnetic) and was a bit of a nuisance on a ladder dropping screws before I got them in place to power them in.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Thank god for detents...........
customer_reviews.text: A while back I bought a set of driver bits and they didn't have the detents. When I bought them they were in their holder and I couldn't see that they had straight shafts with no detents. I should have returned them, but I thought I could live with them. As it turned out they were a big pain, because they are always pulling/falling out of the tool and I couldn't live with them! These have the detents and now I'm happy (the others I gave to one of my enemies).
customer_reviews.author: Rl Shuey

customer_reviews.title: OK for household use, but little else
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, made in China of low quality steel nut driver bits. OK for household use but I would not recommend them for anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Spinoza

customer_reviews.title: A good basic set for home DIY.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this set for home DIY. I don't use it often but the bits seem to be well made and good tollereance fit. You can't go wrong with this set, especially given the low price.
customer_reviews.author: Steven L. Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Bits are well made
customer_reviews.text: Three star on easy to remove, because bits are hard to take out of holder.
customer_reviews.author: K. J. K.

customer_reviews.title: These are primitive, decent backups for driving
customer_reviews.text: The price is right for these drivers. They're not high quality, no magnets, but they'll work in a pinch. I keep them as a backup set to my backup set, I believe in redundancy. 2 is 1, 1 is none. They're very compact, but I'd like the included belt holder to have a tighter grip on the drivers, they slip out pretty easily. All in all, a decent value for a driver set that won't be called on for heavy duty. I wouldn't want to rely on these every day, but they'll work for most homeowners and as backups to your professional set.
customer_reviews.author: J.Carver

customer_reviews.title: TEKTON 2938 Quick-Change Power Nut Driver Bit Set with Detents, 14-Piece
customer_reviews.text: These tools are something you never know when you need one and with the carrying case, there easy to tuck in the tool box or your tool belt and you always have the size required. You would be surprised how many times I found a use after I bought them, The size is on the side of each socket and all the most popular as well as rare sizes. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jimminy Criket

customer_reviews.title: Holster leaves a lot to be desired, sockets are excellent but get lost as a result.
customer_reviews.text: The sockets tent to fall out if left to drift about inside your toolbox. This leaves me digging around the try for it underneath the other tools I store inside. The sockets themselves are sturdy and wells labeled, though I would look into alternate storage holsters if it is going to rattle around inside a truck bed tool box.
customer_reviews.author: Dryheat4u

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with thses
customer_reviews.text: I used these today for the first time and I must say I am very pleased. Drove about 10 tapcon screws into concreate and I actually expected it to break under the strain - not so the held up like a champ. If you ever drove a tapcon screw you know how hard they can be to get in, I no longer use the phillips head ones since I tend to strip the slots or the bit for the phillips head, These look like they will last - and even if they don't the price is right
customer_reviews.author: Bells201

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT fit into quick connect handle; the locking mechanism doesn't close because the bottom part of the bit is too long. I'll grind them down to be shorter and then they'll fit into my tools. Too bad because this was a good value otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: 14 different nut drivers in a convenient holder marked with the sizes made working with sockets so much easier with an electric drill. Sockets fit perfect and don't come off too easily-which is a great thing. Able to help assemble furniture without a problem. Seem to be well made too.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy

customer_reviews.title: Works like it was designed!!
customer_reviews.text: Good for home, known brand, Good set to have in your box!!
customer_reviews.author: photofpd

customer_reviews.title: Good product and GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought and paid for a 14-Piece Nut Driver Bit Set but only received 13 pieces. After I opened it I realized that it was missing the 3/16 nut bit driver. I was initially disappointed to say the least but I was promptly contacted by Meilssa, a TEKTON Customer Support Representative. She promptly sent a replacement bit driver and made this order right by me. I am thoroughly impressed by this level of customer service and I am also satisfied with the product! I would buy from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hagan

customer_reviews.title: Nice set, good price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these specifically for zip screws (self tapping screws, whatever you call them). Not bad, but I would recommend a set with magnets if you don't work around a lot of metal shavings or slag
customer_reviews.author: Bkk

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Good tool,all the important sizes included,could use a better tool storage clip since the bits occasionally fall out. Would not trust it on a belt since the nut drivers tend to fall out. Could benefit from magnetic inserts. Overall i'm satisfied with the purchase especially for the price, it's a bargain. Would definitely buy again even with the above mentioned minor issues.
customer_reviews.author: tx-lonestar1989

customer_reviews.title: good product.  no problems.
customer_reviews.text: works fine. like the carrying holder. only complaint might be not magnetized. But it'll do
customer_reviews.author: Dainbramaged1

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. Inexpensive set that will do the DIY job, may not hold up long to more daily commercial usage.
customer_reviews.author: CBeh

customer_reviews.title: Nice set of Nut Driver bits
customer_reviews.text: I have not used these enough to prove that they have great durability but the quality appears to be very good.
customer_reviews.author: Slowdog

customer_reviews.title: Great bits
customer_reviews.text: These are great bits, not much else to say. The bit holder is tight and seems to retain the bits very well.
customer_reviews.author: Blake G.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality and Utility for Driving Hex Head Screws with Power Screwdriver or Drill
customer_reviews.text: I bought this nut driver bit set as an accessory for my DeWalt power screwdriver. It works great when driving hex-head screws. Way better than trying to use a straight slot screwdriver on hex-head screws. These nut driver bits seem to be made of relatively tough steel, and they fit the screws very well so I've had no problem with them camming out.
customer_reviews.author: James W. Densford III

customer_reviews.title: Work like they should
customer_reviews.text: Nice little set if you're not going to use them everyday or for commercial purposes. Price is right, great for odd jobs around the house or shed. All were there, and work like they should
customer_reviews.author: WAYNEOK

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have and good quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little set. Very happy with my purchase. If only the sockets were a little deeper, it would have my 5 star recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: It will be quick disconnect and will be useful in my man cave
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used this tool set to date. I bought it to use with a small Black n Decker electric wrench. It will be quick disconnect and will be useful in my man cave. I recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Jondauber

customer_reviews.title: Decent Quality Nut Driver Set in SAE and Metric
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for securing gutter brackets, which is what I bought them for. Yeah, I could have bought one of the right size (1/4 in.), but for the price of a single one, I got a whole set.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Great little tools
customer_reviews.text: I have used these several times now and are very happy with them. They not Craftsman or Snapon, but they are good quality sturdy and very useful. A lot of wood screws take a flat head screw driver but the heads themselves are hex. The flat head bits always slide out, It is so much easier to use these than a flat head bit. The included plastic holder is a nice plus keeping them all organized.
customer_reviews.author: toddh

customer_reviews.title: All sizes
customer_reviews.text: I'm a millwright I carry a toolbag nice to have every size in lightweight portable piece
customer_reviews.author: Mike porter

customer_reviews.title: 3/8 isn't perfect?
customer_reviews.text: The cut isn't really clean and smooth. The 3/8 bit isn't perfect. It is a little looser than the others. Not sure why. All my bolts are from Home Depot.
customer_reviews.author: intouch

customer_reviews.title: VERY NICE SET!
customer_reviews.text: I like the holder a lot! It's easy to read and easy to remove and insert bits into. The bits I've used so far have been a perfect fit. I like that it has 8 and 10 mm.
customer_reviews.author: EricF

customer_reviews.title: Home repair and sporadic needs - perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive and works for my very limited anticipated needs. Not sure I would get these if I was going to rely on them as a professional. Home repair and sporadic needs - perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Maiello

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a handy person
customer_reviews.text: Great quality set, was able to get what needed to be done.
customer_reviews.author: Xena

customer_reviews.title: These work great and the price is great as well
customer_reviews.text: These work great and the price is great as well. This is my second TEKTON product purchase and have been very happy with their products so far. Will definitely consider buying more of their products.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy C

customer_reviews.title: Awsome
customer_reviews.text: What I like most is that they all stay together. Nothing falls apart. Good product very easy to use. So simple . It doesn't take a brain to figure it out. I used it every other day to fix something.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for drills
customer_reviews.text: I love these and I recommend them for any tool kit. They are ideal for certain applications at my job. They all fit into my drill head perfectly and are of high quality build. The little red holder is great and makes it easy to know which one to grab when I need a certain size. I would DEFINITELY recommend these to a friend
customer_reviews.author: Alienguru1

customer_reviews.title: Solid value
customer_reviews.text: Good product for the price. I’ve come to like the tekton brand and think they’re like a more trustworthy harbor freight-esque tool maker
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great solid and effective tools
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to my husband to fulfill his tool box set. He tried it couple of times already since we moved to new apartment and he got surprised of the quality and strength of it. I left proud of myself as well of a good choise of it and even helped him by passing the right size of it what was super easy for me due to the written measurements on it. I think if i would need to use it by myself it would be as easy as for handymans.
customer_reviews.author: Agne

customer_reviews.title: Very Convenient
customer_reviews.text: this little thing is very good for you if you have to have some nut drivers on the run...I use them at work just about all the time and they became very useful every single day...they fit into a drill and a interchangable screw driver just fine...they arn't deep....but that hasn't become a problem yet....and it even comes with a belt holder...but I am assuming it is for a two inch construction belt...but it will still be good for a standard one also :)
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Good quality tools
customer_reviews.text: Good quality tools for the price. I have a few of their tools in my work bag so I don't take a chance on my "good" tools stolen.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Best of both world.
customer_reviews.text: It has metric and standard sockets. In one package. In the clearly marked holder. No, it will not make you coffee or wash your car. It just has both metric and standard all in the same place, nicely secured so they won't fall out. I was glad when I found this, and even happier when I received it. So far metal appears to be pretty strong, no issues after a month of daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Hepokritus

customer_reviews.title: Would be nice if the set went a bit bigger
customer_reviews.text: Used this to disassemble and assemble some ikea shelving - made the process very quick. Would be nice if the set went a bit bigger, but has been fine for me so far. Holder is a little annoying - drivers go in on both sides and pushing one in all the way might push another out a little bit. Fine for the money, nicely made.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Martin

customer_reviews.title: Good Item
customer_reviews.text: I like the way the case was formed. The Metal that the sockets were made from seams to a good material. The only thing that seems to be frustrating, is more noticeably on the smaller sockets,say 5, 5.5 mm and 3/16,and 1/14 inches etc.. The Concave angles takes away quite a bit of metal to metal contact. On Lager sockets this quick alignment feature is very helpful to align up the bolt head faster. I also like the six point socket. I don't like 12 point sockets, but that's just me. Thank You Eagle
customer_reviews.author: luapgnik

customer_reviews.title: they appear to be good product. I was told about these from a ...
customer_reviews.text: While I have as of yet, not used them, by appearance of them, they appear to be good product. I was told about these from a friend, so in do time, I will try them out. If they are not what they say it will do, I will be back to revise these remarks.
customer_reviews.author: Harold

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the bits are decent. wording and size that are printed on came off first day with just gripping them in my hands.
customer_reviews.author: Sparx

customer_reviews.title: Work great, haven't stripped
customer_reviews.text: My only gripe is that I'm a fool and didn't order myself the magnetic ones. This little set has all the sizes I need for making repair to NYC Taxi systems and they are a great value for the quality and price. If you're like me and plan on using these while lying sideways, upside down or trying to get to things in tight spots, do yourself a favor and opt for the magnetic set.
customer_reviews.author: Arty Fishull

customer_reviews.title: A really good set
customer_reviews.text: Great for every day carry, its a good pocket sized or secured in a bag. It has both English and metric for common sized bolts you will encounter on a day to day basis. I also carry a larger set in a back pack with adapters to a quick change screw driver making the whole set awesome.
customer_reviews.author: connor james

customer_reviews.title: Nice Nut Driver Set w/Holder
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice set! I initially bought a "Magnetized Nut Driver Set" but due to the magnet inside the socket you couldn't tighten down a nut if the bolt protruded more than about 1⁄4" from the end of the nut. These have a bit deeper of a socket, which eliminates that problem. They seem to be of decent quality, they have a lifetime guarantee, and came at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: T-Weeder Tool

customer_reviews.title: they were inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: These were pretty inexpensive, I dont use them a lot but they add flexibility to my toolbox. I cant speak much on the quality because of infrequent use. But, it is a very full set for very little price and when I need them, they are there and so far they have held up well. For a set this full with the quality of Dewalt or Wiha, you would pay much more. For the frequency I will need them, perfect match.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy E Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Cheap price, High quality
customer_reviews.text: These are great for home improvement projects and my dad loves them. I got this for him with a Dewalt Impact Driver and he is always looking to use them when he can as opposed to his wrenches that he used to love. For the price and holder they come with, they can't be beat. Again, great for home projects, but probably not for industrial use, but haven't tried that out to confirm.
customer_reviews.author: A&J

customer_reviews.title: Power driven Nut drive set
customer_reviews.text: I found this set to be invaluable in the tool box. The plastic base (when new) securely holds the little bits securely so that they may be found instantly. The bits themselves are made of a hardend tool steel and are of good quality, both being sized properly and with good finish. As always, they are a very good cost-effective item when purchased through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Old-dude

product_meta.title: TEKTON 2938 Quick-Change Power Nut Driver Bit Set with Detents, 14-Piece
product_meta.description: Style:Quick ChangeWhether you are a weekend warrior or a professional contractor, the TEKTON 14-Piece Quick-Change Power Nut Driver Bit Set with Detents is a must-have addition to any tool box. Featuring a full range of sizes, this set is ready for use with any power driver or screwgun. Compact storage clip keeps bits handy has a wide belt clip to fit work belts. Constructed from forged and hardened chrome vanadium steel with a corrosion-resistant sandblasted finish, this set is heavy-duty, built to last.Set Includes:7-pc. 1/4 in. hex shank quick-change power inch nut driver bits: 3/16, 1/4, 9/32, 5/16, 11/32, 3/8, 7/16 in.7-pc. 1/4 in. hex shank quick-change power metric nut driver bits: 5, 5.5, 6, 7, 8, 10, 12 mmIncludes workbelt storage clip
feature_bullets: Forged and hardened chrome vanadium steel
Universal 1/4 in. hex shanks fit quick-change chucks and any drill, driver, or screwgun
Set Includes: 7-pc. Power Nut Driver Bits (Inch): 3/16, 1/4, 9/32, 5/16, 11/32, 3/8, 7/16 in., 7-pc. Power Nut Driver Bits (Metric): 5, 5.5, 6, 7, 8, 10, 12 mm
